body:
Probably best to report this upstream with winit/glutin. I don't think there's anything Alacritty can do about this.

However would you mind giving the #1403 PR a shot first? It's a big glutin/winit version jump, so it's possible that this resolves the issue.
This looks like it could be the same as tomaka/winit#636
Thanks for keeping use updated. Looks like that might be related.

At my setup this error was caused by setting `/etc/locale.conf` to an invalid language that was activated inside `/etc/locale.gen` on Arch.
After fixing this, it works fine.
Having the same issue on LM19 tara, any fix?
Having the same issue on Gentoo Linux as well; any fix?
Hmm, it seems I need to change my locale to C for it to work...
Okay, it seems that it specifically doesn't like my language `eo.utf8`, but works fine on simply `eo`.

I'm also running Ubuntu 18.04 on X11 and having the same issue.
Later I found that my `/etc/default/locale` was:
```
LANG="en_HK.UTF-8"
LANGUAGE="en_HK:en"
```
After changing to:
```
LANG="en_CA.UTF-8"
LANGUAGE="en_CA:en"
```
problem was fixed.

Noticed the same behavior on manjaro 18.0.4 with x11 and actual 0.3.3 alacritty installed via manjaro repositories.

Fixed it by moving the binary file to a different path `/opt/alacritty/alacritty` and creating a shell script under `/usr/bin/alacritty`, which simply sets the language without the `.UTF-8`-ending, as suggested by @happysmash27 :

```bash
#!/bin/bash

LANG=en_dk /opt/alacritty/alacritty $@
```
*$@ expands to the script arguments*

My quick test to verify a still utf-8 compatible terminal was to create a `utf8.txt` file with some utf-8-only chars:

```text
äöüß!"'§$%&/()=?°^,.-;:_<>€ƒ†…‡ˆ‰Š‹Œ•—™¶Ø
```

Running `cat utf8.txt` correctly displayed all chars in alacritty and everything else seems to work normally.

After launching alacritty it is possible to export the original LANG value with `.UTF-8`-ending, to ensure compatibility with other programs, f.e. by modifying the `.bashrc`.

issue.title: Alacritty panic at start when en_DK locale is used
issue.body:
I am using alacritty 0.3.2 on Arch Linux with xorg.

I use the en_DK locale on my machine which causes alacritty to panic on startup:
```
 m8769@laptop4023  ~  locale
LANG=en_DK.utf8
LC_CTYPE="en_DK.utf8"
LC_NUMERIC="en_DK.utf8"
LC_TIME="en_DK.utf8"
LC_COLLATE="en_DK.utf8"
LC_MONETARY="en_DK.utf8"
LC_MESSAGES="en_DK.utf8"
LC_PAPER="en_DK.utf8"
LC_NAME="en_DK.utf8"
LC_ADDRESS="en_DK.utf8"
LC_TELEPHONE="en_DK.utf8"
LC_MEASUREMENT="en_DK.utf8"
LC_IDENTIFICATION="en_DK.utf8"
LC_ALL=
 m8769@laptop4023  ~  alacritty 
thread 'main' panicked at 'Failed to open input method: PotentialInputMethods {
    xmodifiers: None,
    fallbacks: [
        PotentialInputMethod {
            name: "@im=local",
            successful: Some(
                false
            )
        },
        PotentialInputMethod {
            name: "@im=",
            successful: Some(
                false
            )
        }
    ],
    _xim_servers: Err(
        GetPropertyError(
            TypeMismatch(
                0
            )
        )
    )
}', /build/.cargo/git/checkouts/winit-081229dbb0c89e9b/57680d2/src/platform/linux/x11/mod.rs:92:17
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.
 ✘ m8769@laptop4023  ~  LANG=en_US.UTF-8
 m8769@laptop4023  ~  alacritty
# Everything is working
```

issue.title: Not running on Manjaro.
issue.body:
Hi, I am using manjaro-gnome, I installed alacritty using snap but while starting it, it gives the following error.

```bash
$ alacritty
alacritty: symbol lookup error: /usr/lib/libfontconfig.so.1: undefined symbol: FT_Done_MM_Var
```
I have also tried installing it using pacman but to no avail.

issue.title: Failed to open input method: PotentialInputMethods
issue.body:
Seems similar to https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/1574. ~I suspect it has something to do with my remote usage.~

Checking locales:

```
> locale
LANG=en_GB.UTF-8
LC_CTYPE="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_NUMERIC="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_TIME="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_COLLATE="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_MONETARY="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_MESSAGES="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_PAPER="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_NAME="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_ADDRESS="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_TELEPHONE="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_MEASUREMENT="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_IDENTIFICATION="en_GB.UTF-8"
LC_ALL=

> cat /etc/locale.conf
LANG=en_GB.UTF-8
```

### System

OS: Arch Linux 5.12.5-arch1-1
Version: alacritty 0.7.2 (5ac8060b)
Linux/BSD: X11, i3 via xrdp

### Logs
```
RUST_BACKTRACE=full alacritty -vvv
thread 'main' panicked at 'Failed to open input method: PotentialInputMethods {
    xmodifiers: None,
    fallbacks: [
        PotentialInputMethod {
            name: "@im=local",
            successful: Some(
                false,
            ),
        },
        PotentialInputMethod {
            name: "@im=",
            successful: Some(
                false,
            ),
        },
    ],
    _xim_servers: Err(
        GetPropertyError(
            TypeMismatch(
                0,
            ),
        ),
    ),
}', /build/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/winit-0.24.0/src/platform_impl/linux/x11/mod.rs:134:17
stack backtrace:
   0:     0x55a5e8cd66d0 - <unknown>
   1:     0x55a5e8badeac - <unknown>
   2:     0x55a5e8cd5f31 - <unknown>
   3:     0x55a5e8cd5895 - <unknown>

   5:     0x55a5e8a8c92a - <unknown>
   6:     0x55a5e8a8c8fc - <unknown>
   7:     0x55a5e89f15f1 - <unknown>
   8:     0x55a5e8a4415b - <unknown>
   9:     0x55a5e8affa67 - <unknown>
  10:     0x55a5e8b34e13 - <unknown>
  11:     0x55a5e8aa0203 - <unknown>
  12:     0x55a5e8b34a85 - <unknown>
  13:     0x7fe909f6cb25 - __libc_start_main
  14:     0x55a5e89f106e - <unknown>
  15:                0x0 - <unknown>
```
